channel.title: carpentry on HowIsJT
channel.description: Recent content in carpentry on HowIsJT

item.title: 16. Paddles and Back Rests
item.description: Paddles and seat back rests are accessories commonly purchased as commercial products to complete one’s kayak. I decided to construct my own.

item.title: 15. A Timelapse and Cockpit Combing
item.description: I can build three kayaks in 2-1/2 minutes! Well, maybe if you watch my 2 minute and 20 second timelapse video.

item.title: 10. You Can't Hurry Love
item.description: No, you can’t hurry love when you’re building three kayaks from plans.

item.title: 9. Chill Out!
item.description: Winter has arrived in south Louisiana as evidenced by this icicle dangling from a hose bib. The cool weather halts epoxy work as it won’t cure.

item.title: 8. Cutting Hatches
item.description: Time to cut the hatches! I was nervous about this step, but I took my time and it was easy.

item.title: 7. Project Resumes
item.description: Divine providence has provided an opportunity to resume building kayaks.

item.title: 5. Panels Cut
item.description: It is a relief… to be finished with cutting out the panels. I anticipated it would be challenging but it took much longer than I expected.

item.title: 4. Begin!
item.description: Measure twice…cut once! We begin the careful process of cutting the components for the kayaks from plywood sheets.

item.title: 3. Setting Up Shop
item.description: Making room to assemble these boats seems nearly as challenging as building them.
